TYPE.description: The type of the component
TYPE.title: Type

CONDITION.description:
All consumers may have a keyword CONDITION which specifies conditions for the consumer to be used. 

At points in the time series where the condition evaluates to 0 (or False), the energy consumption will be 0. 

This is practical for some otherwise constant consumers, for example, fixed production loads, which have a constant 

load whenever there is production. CONDITION supports the functionality described in Expressions, 

but is required to evaluate to True/False or 1/0.
CONDITION.title: Condition

CONDITIONS.description:
A consumer system my have the keywords CONDITIONS which specifies conditions for the consumers to be used. 

    At points in the time series where the condition evaluates to 0 (or False), the energy consumption will be 0. 

    This is practical for some otherwise constant consumers, for example, fixed production loads, which have a constant 

    load whenever there is production. CONDITIONS supports the functionality described in Expressions, 

    but is required to evaluate to True/False or 1/0.
CONDITIONS.title: Conditions

CROSSOVER.description:
CROSSOVER specifies if rates are to be crossed over to another consumer if rate capacity is exceeded. If the energy consumption calculation is not successful for a consumer, and the consumer has a valid cross-over defined, the consumer will be allocated its maximum rate and the exceeding rate will be added to the cross-over consumer.
To avoid loops, a consumer can only be either receiving or giving away rate. For a cross-over to be valid, the discharge pressure at the consumer "receiving" overshooting rate must be higher than or equal to the discharge pressure of the "sending" consumer. This is because it is possible to choke pressure down to meet the outlet pressure in a flow line with lower pressure, but not possible to "pressure up" in the crossover flow line.
Some examples show how the crossover logic works:
Crossover is given as and list of integer values for the first position is the first consumer, second position is the second consumer, etc. The number specifies which consumer to send cross-over flow to, and 0 signifies no cross-over possible. Note that we use 1-index here.
Example 1:
Two consumers where there is a cross-over such that if the rate for the first consumer exceeds its capacity, the excess rate will be processed by the second consumer. The second consumer can not cross-over to anyone.
CROSSOVER: [2, 0]
Example 2:
The first and second consumers may both send exceeding rate to the third consumer if their capacity is exceeded.
CROSSOVER: [3,3,0]
CROSSOVER.title: Crossover

INLET_PRESSURE.description: Inlet pressure [bara] as a single expression This inlet pressure will be the same for all components in the consumer system.
INLET_PRESSURE.title: Inlet pressure

INLET_PRESSURES.description: Inlet pressures [bara] as a list of expressions.
INLET_PRESSURES.title: Inlet pressures

OUTLET_PRESSURE.description: Outlet pressure [bara] as a single expression This inlet pressure will be the same for all components in the consumer system.
OUTLET_PRESSURE.title: Outlet pressure

OUTLET_PRESSURES.description: Outlet pressures [bara] as a list of expressions.
OUTLET_PRESSURES.title: Outlet pressures

POWERLOSSFACTOR.description:
A factor that may be added to account for power transmission losses. E.g. if you have a subsea installation with a 

power line to another installation, there may be line losses. For a power line loss of 5%, POWER_LOSS_FACTOR is set to 

0.05 and the power required from the power source (generator set) will be:


power_requirement = power_before_loss / (1 - power_loss_factor)
POWERLOSSFACTOR.title: Power loss factor

POWERLOSSFACTORS.description:
A consumer system may have list of POWER_LOSS_FACTOR that may be added to account for power transmission losses.
    E.g. if you have a subsea installation with a power line to another installation, there may be line losses. 

    For a power line loss of 5%, POWER_LOSS_FACTOR is set to 0.05 and the power required from the power source 

    (generator set) will be:


    power_requirement = power_before_loss / (1 - power_loss_factor)
POWERLOSSFACTORS.title: Power loss factors

RATES.description:
Rates [Sm3/day] as a list of expressions

This is mutually exclusive with RATE_FRACTIONS.
RATES.title: Rates

RATE_FRACTIONS.description:
Rate fractions of total system rate, as a list of floats between 0 and 1.

This requires TOTAL_SYSTEM_RATE to be defined.
This is mutually exclusive with RATES.
RATE_FRACTIONS.title: Rate fractions

TOTAL_SYSTEM_RATE.description:
The total system rate expression.

Should be used with RATE_FRACTIONS in OPERATIONAL_SETTINGS.
TOTAL_SYSTEM_RATE.title: Total system rate

ENERGY_USAGE_MODEL.title: ENERGY_USAGE_MODEL

schema.title: Asset

schema.description: Category

anyOf.description:
Anything that doesn't belong in the other categories.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: MISCELLANEOUS

anyOf.description:
Consumers that do not vary with production.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: BASE-LOAD

anyOf.description:
Consumer that is fixed/constant when production stream is on.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: FIXED-PRODUCTION-LOAD

anyOf.description:
Flaring related energy usage/emissions.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: FLARE

anyOf.description:
Direct emissions through cold venting and fugitive emissions.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: COLD-VENTING-FUGITIVE

anyOf.description:
Gas injection compressors, export compressors, etc..

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: COMPRESSOR

anyOf.description:
Single speed pumps, variable speed pumps.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: PUMP

anyOf.description:
Fixed installation. Reserved for use with INSTALLATION, normally with LTP.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: FIXED

anyOf.description:
Mobile installation. Reserved for use with installation, normally with LTP.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: MOBILE

anyOf.description:
Fuel Gas. Reserved for use with fuel types, normally with LTP.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: FUEL-GAS

anyOf.description:
Diesel. Reserved for use with fuel types, normally with LTP.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: DIESEL

anyOf.description:
Used for LTP, to indicate that a compressor is gas (turbine) driven. Valid for compressors only. 

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: GAS-DRIVEN-COMPRESSOR

anyOf.description:
Used for LTP, to indicate power to el-driven equipment from a gas turbine generator only. Valid for gensets only. 

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: TURBINE-GENERATOR

anyOf.description:
Used for LTP, to indicate that the genset is a dummy (with 0 fuel) for power import from shore. Valid for gensets only. 

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: POWER-FROM-SHORE

anyOf.description:
Used for LTP, to indicate that the power is offshore wind. Should have negative load  (in order to deduct from total). Valid for direct consumer only. 

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: OFFSHORE-WIND

anyOf.description:
Used for LTP, to indicate oil volume to be loaded. Oil volume per timestep equals fuel. Valid for direct consumer only. 

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: LOADING

anyOf.description:
Used for LTP, to indicate oil volume to be stored. Oil volume per timestep equals fuel. Valid for direct consumer only. 

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: STORAGE

anyOf.description:
Used for LTP, to indicate energy provided through steam turbine generator. Should have negative load  (in order to deduct from total). Valid for direct consumer only. 

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY.html
anyOf.title: STEAM-TURBINE-GENERATOR

anyOf.description:
Used for LTP, to indicate steam generated. 

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: BOILER

anyOf.description:
Used for LTP, to indicate hot medium generated. 

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/CATEGORY
anyOf.title: HEATER

TURBINE_EFFICIENCIES.description: Efficiency values in load vs efficiency table for turbine. Efficiency is given as fraction between 0 and 1 corresponding to 0-100%. Number of elements must correspond to number of elements in TURBINE_LOADS. See documentation for more information.
TURBINE_EFFICIENCIES.title: TURBINE_EFFICIENCIES

TURBINE_LOADS.description: Load values [MW] in load vs efficiency table for turbine. Number of elements must correspond to number of elements in TURBINE_EFFICIENCIES. See documentation for more information.

INTERSTAGE_CONTROL_PRESSURE.description: Defines what measure will be used to control the pressure of the compressor train.

DOWNSTREAM_PRESSURE_CONTROL.description: Defines the measure to use to control the pressure of the compressor train after the stage with interstage pressure, if the compressor train before the interstage pressure is controlled by speed.
DOWNSTREAM_PRESSURE_CONTROL.title: DOWNSTREAM_PRESSURE_CONTROL

UPSTREAM_PRESSURE_CONTROL.description: Defines the measure to use to control the pressure of the compressor train prior to the stage with interstage pressure, if the compressor train after the interstage pressure is controlled by speed.
UPSTREAM_PRESSURE_CONTROL.title: UPSTREAM_PRESSURE_CONTROL

INTERSTAGE_CONTROL_PRESSURE.title: INTERSTAGE_PRESSURE_CONTROL

STREAM.description: List of names of the stream(s) connected to this compressor stage. The stream(s) must have been defined under STREAMS.
STREAM.title: STREAM

STREAMS.description: Defines the streams of the compressor train, whether the stream is INGOING or OUTGOING, and if it is INGOING also the name of the FLUID_MODEL

FLUID_MODEL.description: Name of the fluid model connected to the stream.
FLUID_MODEL.title: FLUID_MODEL

Defines the inputs for time dependent variables, or “reservoir variables”.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/TIME_SERIES

Defines whether the rates in the source should be set to 0 after last time step or constant equal to value at last time step after time interval.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/EXTRAPOLATION
EXTRAPOLATION.title: EXTRAPOLATION

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/FILE
FILE.title: FILE

INFLUENCE_TIME_VECTOR.description:
Determines if the time steps in this input source will contribute to the global time vector.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/INFLUENCE_TIME_VECTOR
INFLUENCE_TIME_VECTOR.title: INFLUENCE_TIME_VECTOR

anyOf.description:
The value at a certain time step is defining the value in the time interval before this time step.

EXTRAPOLATION.description:
Defines whether the rates in the source should be set to 0 after last time step or constant equal to value at last time step after time interval.

https://test.ecalc.equinor.com/docs/docs/modelling/keywords/EXTRAPOLATION
EXTRAPOLATION.title: EXTRAPOLATION
